title: 17 Inspiring Prayers that Say "Thank You, God"

steps.content: “Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; his love endures forever.” — Psalm 118:1 Gracious God, I offer you my heartfelt gratitude for all the blessings you have bestowed upon me. Thank you for your never-ending love and care, which have sustained me through every trial and challenge. Thank you for your grace and mercy, which have guided me on my journey through life. Thank you for your presence in my life, which brings me hope and joy. I am so grateful for all that you are and all that you do, and I pray that I may always show my gratitude through my words and actions. Amen. [1] X Research source Holy Bible expert Olivia Woodford suggests that “the first thing you can do is express gratitude through prayer. There's so much that we take for granted like the air that we breathe, the beauty of the flowers, or the foods that we eat.”

“But thanks be to God, who gives us the victory through our Lord Jesus Christ.” — Corinthians 15:57 O Lord, thank you that you love me and that you give me comfort like no other. Thank you that you are a God who is well acquainted with all our grief and that you ache when I ache. Help me to remember that in the midst of struggles, trials, and utter heartbreak you offer hope. You are the Author of Hope and Salvation. I praise you that through the sacrifice of your Son, Jesus, all things are put under your feet. Allow me to trust your heart and believe that there is more to life than the heartache of this world. Allow me to lean ever closer to you in the midst of this fallen world. Thank you, God, for hope, peace, your love, your comfort, and your salvation. Amen. — Annah Matthews [2] X Research source

“Give thanks in all circumstances; for this is the will of God in Christ Jesus for you.” — 1 Thessalonians 5:18 Heavenly Father, thank you for caring about my life. Thank you that I can talk to you about everything. I have lots of concerns so I’m bringing each one to you. Thank you for promising to give me your peace. In Jesus’ Name, Amen. — Sheila Walsh [3] X Research source

The steadfast love of the Lord never ceases; his mercies never come to an end; they are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.” — Lamentations 3:22-23 Almighty God, your love and mercy are beyond comprehension. I thank you for your unfailing love that never ceases and your mercies that are new every morning. You have forgiven my sins, healed my wounds, and embraced me with open arms. Your mercy has been my refuge, and your love has been the foundation of my life. I cannot thank you enough for the way you love me, unconditionally and unceasingly. I offer you my praise and gratitude for being my God, my Savior, my Friend. [4] X Research source

“Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything by prayer and supplication with thanksgiving let your requests be made known to God. And the peace of God, which surpasses all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus.” — Philippians 4:6-7 Dear Lord, I praise you and I love being in your presence. Thank you for the sacrifice you made for me on the cross. Thank you for helping my heart to rest in your presence. In a busy world, it is here that I find truth, grace, and mercy. My heart is overwhelmingly grateful. As it overflows with gratitude, may you present opportunities for me to serve. In Jesus’ Name, I pray, Amen. — Mindy Lee Hopman [5] X Research source

“For everything God created is good, and nothing is to be rejected if it is received with thanksgiving.” — 1 Timothy 4:4-5 I come before you with a heart full of gratitude and praise. Thank you for your abundant love, mercy, and the countless blessings you pour into my life. For every moment of joy, every answered prayer, and even for the challenges that teach me and draw me closer to you, I give thanks. Thank you for your constant presence and for guiding me through each step of my journey. I am grateful for the strength you provide in times of weakness, the comfort you offer in times of sorrow, and the hope you instill in my heart. Lord, I express my sincere thanks for all that you have done and continue to do. Help me to live each day with a spirit of gratitude, recognizing your hand in every blessing and trusting you in every moment. In Jesus’ name, I pray. Amen. — Jonah McKeown [6] X Research source

“Always giving thanks to God the Father for everything, in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ.” — Ephesians 2:20 Heavenly Father, thank you for life and hope and bravery. Thank you that even at my weakest, I can rely on you for strength. Remind me of the bravery you’ve called me to step into today and help me to encourage others with the mighty hope of the Lord too. In Jesus’ Name, Amen. — Joni Eareckson Tada [7] X Research source

“So do not fear, for I am with you; do not be dismayed, for I am your God. I will strengthen you and help you.” — Isaiah 41:10 God, I thank you for giving me countless reasons to lift my head high and walk. You have always given me beauty for ashes, strength when I’m weak, and joy that overflows in the abundance of my heart. I am so grateful that I know who I am and I can be identified with you. Lord God Almighty, thank you for the fiery spirit to press on through the attacks of the enemy. I thank you that I can respond to every situation in my life through the dictates of the Spirit of God. [8] X Research source

“And let the peace of Christ rule in your hearts, to which indeed you were called in one body. And be thankful.” — Colossians 3:15 Almighty God, my Eternal Father, I approach your throne of grace with a heart overflowing with gratitude. In the mundane and miraculous moments of this day, open my eyes to see your hand at work. Awaken my spirit to the countless blessings that surround me – the air I breathe, the food on my table, the love of family and friends. Lord, cultivate in me a spirit of perpetual thanksgiving, that I might glorify you in all circumstances. May my life become a living testimony of your goodness and grace. As I walk through this day, let gratitude be the rhythm of my heart, the song on my lips, and the light that shines through my actions. In Jesus’ name, I pray. Amen. [9] X Research source

“Make every effort to live in peace with everyone and to be holy.” — Hebrews 12:14 Prince of Peace, my soul finds rest in gratitude for your faithful presence. Thank you for the peace that surpasses understanding, guarding my heart and mind. I’m grateful for the calm you bring to my storms, the stillness you speak into my chaos. Lord, as I cultivate gratitude, let it pave the way for deeper peace in my life. May thankfulness quiet my anxious thoughts and calm my restless spirit. Let the peace born of gratitude overflow from my life, bringing your serenity to those around me. In gratitude, I find my peace; in peace, I deepen my gratitude. In Jesus’ name, my ultimate Peace, I pray. Amen. [10] X Research source

“Honor your father and your mother, so that you may live long in the land the Lord your God is giving you.” — Exodus 20:12 Dear God, We come before you with grateful hearts to give thanks for our families. We are blessed to have them in our lives and are thankful for their love, support, and companionship. We pray for continued blessings upon each member of our families, for good health, happiness, and prosperity. Help us to always cherish the time we have with one another, and to show love and compassion in all that we do. Thank you for bringing us together as one and for the unbreakable bond of love and family. Amen. [11] X Research source

“If either of them falls down, one can help the other up. But pity anyone who falls and has no one to help them up.” — Ecclesiastes 4:10 Dear God, I offer my sincere gratitude for the blessings of friendship in my life. I am thankful for the laughter, love, and support that my friends bring into my life. I am grateful for their kindness and understanding, and for the joy they bring to my heart. I pray that I may be a true friend in return, always there to lend a helping hand and offer a listening ear. May our bonds of friendship grow stronger with each passing day, and may we continue to bring happiness and comfort to one another. Thank you for the gift of friendship, and for the love that surrounds us always. Amen. [12] X Research source

“Pray that God blesses your children and that you cherish them.” — Psalm 127:3 Thank you Lord for giving me my beautiful child. For safely bringing us through a difficult pregnancy and a difficult delivery. Please be with him throughout his life and I pray that we are around and in good health to see him grow into a fine young man, happy and prosperous with a family of his own and a compassionate and beautiful heart. Amen. [13] X Research source

“Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good. His love endures forever.”— Psalm 136:1 Thank you for your great love and blessing over our lives. Thank you that your favor has no end, but it lasts for our entire lifetime. Forgive us for sometimes forgetting that you are intimately acquainted with all of our ways, that you know what concerns us, and you cover us with a shield. Establish the work of our hands and bring to fulfillment all that you have given us to do in these days. We pray that you would make our way purposeful and our footsteps firm out of your goodness and love. Give us a heart of wisdom to hear your voice, and make us strong by your huge favor and grace. In Jesus' Name, Amen. — Debbie McDaniel [14] X Research source

“I always thank my God for you because of his grace given you in Christ Jesus.” — 1 Corinthians 1:4 Dear God, I am so grateful for all that you have given me. Thank you for your love, grace, and mercy, which guide me through every day. Thank you for your presence in my life, which brings me hope and joy. I am so blessed to have you in my life, and I am eternally grateful for all that you do. Amen. [15] X Research source

“Weeping may endure for a night, but joy comes in the morning.” — Psalm 30:5 Heavenly Father, As I open my eyes to a new day, I want to pause and thank you for the gift of life and the breath in my lungs. Thank you for the rest I received through the night and for the strength to rise and greet this morning. Your mercies are new every morning, and I am grateful for your unwavering love and faithfulness. Thank you for the blessings that surround me—both big and small—and for the opportunity to see your goodness in each moment. I am thankful for the people in my life, for the opportunities you provide, and for the beauty of your creation that I witness each day. Lord, guide me as I move through today with a heart of gratitude. Help me to carry this thankfulness into all that I do, so that my words and actions reflect your love and grace. In Jesus’ name, I pray. Amen.

“In peace I will lie down and sleep, for you alone, Lord, make me dwell in safety.” — Psalm 4:8 Heavenly Father, As I close my day, I come before you with a heart full of gratitude. Thank you for the gift of life and for every moment you have given me today. I am grateful for the breath in my lungs, the strength in my body, and the opportunities to experience your love and grace. Thank you God for guiding me through the day, for the moments of joy, and for the lessons learned through challenges. I trust that each day is a blessing from you, and I am thankful for the many ways you have provided for me. Lord, as I rest tonight, I ask for your peace and protection. Thank you for the promise of a new day tomorrow, and for the assurance that you are with me always. I entrust my life into your hands and praise you for the gift of another day. In Jesus’ name, I pray. Amen. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Take time each day to give thanks to God
steps.content: Take time each day to give thanks to God . You can show gratitude to God no matter what your day brings. Start your day with a prayer of appreciation and thanks and end it in the same way—thankful for all your blessings. By thinking about the difficulties you experience and the good things you have, you can praise God through Bible verses, praying , and positive thoughts that say “thank you.” [17] X Research source Start your day with thanks . You can do this first thing in the morning by saying a well-rounded prayer to God or a prayer of Thanksgiving to the Lord. If you want to be prepared, simply write out your prayer the night before so you have it by your side when you wake up. Meditate on gratitude when you worship . Sing the Lord’s praises when you’re at church, in the car, walking the dog, or cooking dinner. Your thankfulness will radiate out and bring many blessings back to you even when you’re not praying to God . Give thanks as you read scripture . Take time to read Bible verses carefully and thoughtfully. Think about what God has in mind for you and how each story or fable can teach you about gratitude and giving back. Thank God for both the blessings and challenges . When you pray as a Christian , you show gratitude for good and bad experiences. This helps take the focus away from your own issues and places it back onto God, where it belongs. Continue to thank God for every blessing he has given you and you can enjoy a spiritually fulfilled life.
